Class TreeUtils

java.lang.Object
  




public class TreeUtils
extends Object

Utility procedures for binary tree structures.

Version:
25/2/2015
Author:
Stephan Jamieson

Method Detail

contains

public static boolean contains(AVLTreeNode node,
                               Integer key)
Determine whether the given tree structure contains the given key.

doubleRotateWithLeftChild

public static AVLTreeNode doubleRotateWithLeftChild(AVLTreeNode k3)
Double rotate binary tree node: first rotate k3's left child with its right child; then rotate node k3 with the new left child. This is a double rotation for case 2.

doubleRotateWithRightChild

public static AVLTreeNode doubleRotateWithRightChild(AVLTreeNode k1)
Double rotate binary tree node: first rotate k1's right child with its left child; then rotate node k1 with the new right child. This is a double rotation for case 3.

height

public static int height(AVLTreeNode node)
Obtain the height value of the given node.

Returns:
0 if node==null, otherwise node.getHeight().

insert

public static AVLTreeNode insert(AVLTreeNode node,
                                 Integer key)
Recursive implementation of insert on an AVLTreeNode structure.

isPlaceHolder

public static boolean isPlaceHolder(AVLTreeNode node)
Determine whether node is a place holder i.e. node==AVLTreeNode.EMPTY_NODE

levelZero

public static List<AVLTreeNode> levelZero(AVLTreeNode tNode)
Obtain a list containing the root node of the given structure i.e. tNode itself.

nextLevel

public static List<AVLTreeNode> nextLevel(List<AVLTreeNode> level)
Given a list of nodes, obtain the next level.

If the tree structure is incomplete, AVLTreeNode.EMPTY_NODE is inserted as a place holder for each missing node.

rotateWithLeftChild

public static AVLTreeNode rotateWithLeftChild(AVLTreeNode k2)
Rotate binary tree node with left child. This is a single rotation for case 1.

rotateWithRightChild

public static AVLTreeNode rotateWithRightChild(AVLTreeNode k1)
Rotate binary tree node with right child. This is a single rotation for case 4.
